sub_title: Strategic, systems and sustainability thinker. Passionate Leader with robust experience engaging with C-level.
summary:
My leadership journey started early: by the age of 25, I was leading a team of 50+ people as head of a region with 6 business units. I am a passionate and values-driven leader with demonstrated experience in building cultures where people thrive. 

20+ years in the education, leadership development, travel and events sectors, leading global teams, L&D, business development, change management, growth & operations. Robust expertise in partnership with C-Suite executives globally.

Strong influencing skills and ability to influence organisations towards sustainable growth and human-centered leadership and design. I can easily balance strategic thinking with execution.

I like to develop people and unleash their talent through empowerment and focusing on what drives them and makes them excel. My leadership is about developing trusted spaces for creativity, problem-solving and sustainable solutions.

In any system, behaviour follows structure... Proven ability to identify opportunities for sustainable growth and solve systemic issues, having developed and delivered several complex, cross-functional legacy projects around customer centricity and operational efficiency, that became benchmark for other areas of the business. 

VALUES: trust, authenticity, sustainability, health, compassion, accountability and development 
PASSIONS: authentic and responsible leadership, business impact and sustainability, people development, expectation management, process improvement, outdoors, active lifestyle and wellness.

education.field_of_study: Common Earth Insights: Developing a Systemic Understanding of Climate Change

school.name: The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)

education.field_of_study: Purpose and Profit: The Essentials of Social Business

I work for private companies that improve public services to people

profile_positions.title: Global Forum (Peer Learning Groups) Services Director

profile_positions.description:
Strategic leadership and strategy building to scale peer-to-peer connections, trust, effective learning design and idea exchange across YPO. Responsible for a team focused on distribution to channels (global events, content per affinity groups, regions and leadership development), development of frameworks and tools for business process improvement, and the learning experience for 1200+ CEOs in leadership roles at the organisation. 

Support International Board/Committee comprised of CEOs in building the learning for 30K+ CEOs.

Key leadership role for two restructure projects: The merger of two departments into a Centre of Excellence and the transition of 40% of the team to a new department, leading organisational design, restructure, change management, benchmark onboarding and communication projects.
profile_positions.title: Forum & Learning Global Development Director

profile_positions.description:
Lead Regional Learning Managers, learning services and grow peer-to-peer C-level mentoring across APAC & EMEA. Co-development of Global Learning and Insights Department strategy. 
Oversee the design and delivery of leadership development and learning journey design for 1000+ learning leaders: from yearly workshop to blended learning experience including on-demand, virtual, just in time onboarding and in-person workshops.

Support International Board committee comprised of CEOs in building the learning for 30K+ CEOs.

Led Roadmap integration to Salesforce Marketing Cloud to simplify and standardize onboarding, just in time learning and track engagement of leaders, integrated to Salesforce Marketing Cloud. 500+ users in year one, doubling user growth in 2022 and target growth to 5,000+ in 2023.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager, Learning - APAC & EMEA

profile_positions.description:
Determine annual priorities and develop, implement, and achieve strategic plans and goals for learning and mentoring in the region, working in close partnership with CEOs across Europe.

Work with thought leaders, authors, heads of state and top faculty from Harvard and LBS.

Thought leadership for Business with Purpose / Impact global content thread: curation and development of cutting-edge content and strategy for content-thread, including global learning preferences survey, content activation and distribution on channels, on-demand content and content curation for YPO’s global conference of 3000+ CEOs, featuring learning experiences with Michelle Obama, Adam Grant, President Iván Duque Marquez, Arthur Brooks, Gillian Tett (FT), Frank Luntz and others.

Award recipient: granted to the 6 top performers of the Global L&I Team.
profile_positions.title: Regional Learning, Europe

profile_positions.description:
Corporate global event projects management agency with offices in London and Rio – www.mindworld.co  Services provided: incentive travel, high luxury travel, product launches, awards, large congresses, sponsorship activations and other types of events

Business strategy, financial planning, procurement, industry relationship, sales, client acquisition and operations in London and Rio. Overseeing C-level executives’ experience and client service across the globe. Leader of large international teams (up to 25 members). Extensive global travel for B2B and B2G sales / business development.

•	Awarded by the UK Government (DIT) for company’s investment in the UK during the British Brazilian Awards ceremony at the Foreign & Commonwealth Office in London.
•	Achieved average of 68% repeated business per annum and 70%+ international clients. 
•	2014 Football World Cup contracts: Management of 23 simultaneous projects, 40 team members and 100+ suppliers nationwide over a period of 6 months.
•	2016 Olympic Games contracts: management of 10 simultaneous projects (including all activations for one of the sponsors) and 30 team members over a period of 3 months.
•	Led rebranding process from MindRio to MindWorld.

profile_positions.title: Head of Business Development

profile_positions.description:
STB - Student Travel Bureau, Rio, Brazil  - Multinational leading educational travel agency, sends over 50.000 Brazilians to study abroad yearly 

General management of the retail B2C operations in the states of Rio de Janeiro and Espírito Santo, including 6 business units and annual turnover of R$30+ million (U$6 million). Leader of 6 managers and 45 employees focused on consultative sales and recruiting students for a variety of international education programmes. Report to VP. PR/spokesperson for the company for all media channels in the region. 
•	Led restructure and change management projects, resulting in change of culture, in line with company’s values and standards.
•	Profitability growth: 30%+ & sales growth average: 10%+/year.
•	National record of sales of the ISIC – International Student Identity Card.
•	Introduced the role of Quality Manager and led a benchmark project focusing on flow analytics, time invested per type of client and sales conversion in the offices, scaled across the business.
•	Management, promotion and recruitment for Walt Disney World’s International Work Programme.

profile_positions.description:
Student Travel Bureau, Sao Paulo, Brazil  -  Multinational leading educational travel agency, sends over 50.000 Brazilians to study abroad yearly
 
Responsible for all product development and sales of all international work exchange programmes. Leader of 8 people and Product Sales Leader for 55 B2C retail office managers. Extensive negotiation, product development and procurement in the USA, Europe and Australia. Branding, PR and marketing development of the products with the highest profitability within the company’s portfolio.

Key achievements: 
•	Elected for 2 years as Treasurer and Board member of the international association Wyse Work Abroad.  
•	Training and development of 55 B2C retail office managers and 100+ subject-matter experts.
•	Successfully reverted sales trend of products through training focused on managing expectations effectively. 
•	Sales growth by 300% in the first year, keeping the results for the following years due to suppliers’ capacity. 
•	Successful crisis management, leading escalations, support to students with emergencies abroad and investigation/negotiation of complex lawsuits.
